meanings.definition: To pay back (money that is owed)
meanings.sent1: I will repay the loan next week.
meanings.sent2: She always repays her debts on time.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel promised to repay the acorn with a shiny pebble.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness repaid itself in the form of lifelong friendship.
meanings.sent5: He felt relieved after repaying the borrowed money.

meanings.definition: To make return for (a kindness or service)
meanings.sent1: I want to repay your help with a small gift.
meanings.sent2: She repaid his generosity by offering her assistance.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to repay the favor by bringing a toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: Her smile repaid his efforts more than words could express.
meanings.sent5: He always finds ways to repay the kindness shown to him.

meanings.sent1: He apologized and promised to repay the damage caused.
meanings.sent2: She tried to repay her mistake by helping to fix it.
meanings.sent3: The clown attempted to repay the mishap with a funny dance.
meanings.sent4: Her sincere apology repaid the hurt feelings.
meanings.sent5: He worked hard to repay the error and regain trust.
